Message.Title: Mozilla Takes Aim At A Global Duopoly With Firefox OS And The Open Web
Message.Msg: Google it... Quoting: "Firefox’s mobile OS is not a traditional operating system like iOS or Android. It’s written entirely in HTML5, the underlying programming language of the Web. Apps run from the Web and hook into the phone’s hardware and data, and can also run offline. Firefox OS can make do with half the phone memory Android needs, so carriers can price a smartphone for well under $100, or half the price of a low-end Android smartphone."

Message.Title: Microsoft's Surface Pro May Be Available in China Next Week
Message.Msg: Might be very good news for MSFT since China seems to be angry with AAPL. Virginia Ballot on Microsoft Surface Pro Tablet (Photo credit: IntelFreePress) Microsoft’s Surface Pro tablet is finally getting a second market, China, at least according a posting on popular chinese website Weibo. The post, presumably by a representative of Tmall, an official Microsoft partner in China, says that the tablet/laptop hybrids will be available to Chinese buyers on April 2nd.

Message.Title: NASA ONLY WANTS A RELIABLE OS (LINUX) ... NOT WINBLOW$ !!!
Message.Msg: It’s hard to get tech support 400 kilometers away from the Earth, which is why Keith Chuvala of United Space Alliance, a NASA contractor deeply involved in Space Shuttle and International Space Station (ISS) operations, decided to migrate to Linux. As leader of the Laptops and Network Integration Teams, Chuvala oversees the developers in charge of writing and integrating software for the Station’s “OpsLAN” – a network of laptops that provide the ISS crew with vital capabilities for day-to-day operations, from telling the astronauts where they are, to inventory control of the equipment used, to interfacing with the cameras that capture photos and videos. “We migrated key functions from Windows to Linux because we needed an operating system that was stable and reliable –

Not only can they hack into the phone to get a password, snoop emails it is worse MUCH WORSE. Due to the 400 apps you cannot get rid of and allowing access to your camera, microphone and location for the maps it is game on for Mr. Evil Hacker. He can turn your microphone on and listen to every sound day or usually at night so the creeps can hear moaning. They may get intrigued to turn on the camera and use it as a hidden web cam. And the cherry on top, they wait until you are 40 miles away as they watch your phone moving further away on the goog map. Then when you are long gone, the safe robbery occurs. Missle's are not the only thing Android phone users have to worry about. How about your identity, privacy & life. Mr. Softie is serving a double scoop of security with a sandbox environment on top. If you have an Andriod, ENJOY!
